translated: then lived in Takkasilā;🔽taking a Vallikāra fruit,
I offered it to the Self-Made One.
I do not recall a bad destination,
this is the fruit of offering the fruit.
My defilements have been burned up,
Welcome indeed it was for me,
I have done what the Awakened One said.

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā vallikāraphaladāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmā vallikāraphaladāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done what the Awakened One said.”🔽Thus the elder Vallikāraphaladāyaka recited these verses.
The Elder Vallikāraphaladāyaka’s Birth Story is the eighth.
